page.title: 01NORTH EAST BLACKBURN
page.content: This area covers the North East quadrant of Blackburn and the area of farming land between Blackburn and the neighbouring town of Rishton. The area is roughly divided equally between the urban spread of Blackburn and the rough grazing land to the East of Rishton.The farming land is used entirely for the grazing of cattle and heep. The urban area of Blackburn comprises an inner section of "Grid-Iron" terraced housing almost entirely occupied by the Asian community, and an outer area of post 1918 and modern property largely occupied by the "English" community. Although the entire area once supported many textile firms these have disappeared, their modern replacements preferring sites on the new Industrial Estate at Whitebirk.
